Inside the Meta Richland Parish Data Center: Meet our Campus Facility Director ğŸ‘‹ Micah Petty leads the team supporting our largest Meta data center to date in Richland Parish, Louisiana, a data center that will play a vital role in accelerating our AI progress, delivering over 2 gigawatts of compute capacity to train future open source large language models. The team is building best practices, creating a collaborative culture, and setting new standards for our industry. If you want to be part of a project that will make an impact for years to come, and youâ€™re ready to make a difference, thereâ€™s no better time to join us!â€ ğŸ¡ What makes Richland Parish a great place to live and work? â€œRichland Parish is the ideal spot for our data center team, combining a strategic location, affordability, and a welcoming community. With easy commutes, a low cost of living, access to quality housing and a vibrant local food scene with highly rated restaurants, youâ€™ll find both financial freedom and a true sense of belonging. The areaâ€™s strong sense of community, educational resources, and abundant outdoor activities make work-life balance and career growth a reality. What stands out most is our teamâ€™s energy and spirit. We take our jobs seriously, but we have fun at work!â€ â­We are hiring subject matter experts! Proud to share Metaâ€™s latest network infrastructure announcements from the 2025 OCP Global Summit! At Meta, we believe that open hardware and collaborative innovation are key to building the next generation of AI-ready data centers. This year, our team has announced: â¡ï¸ The evolution of our Disaggregated Scheduled Fabric (DSF), now supporting building-scale, non-blocking fabrics for large AI clusters. â¡ï¸ Our new Non-Scheduled Fabric (NSF) architecture, leveraging shallow-buffer 51T Ethernet switches to drive lower latency and higher performance for our largest gigawatt-scale clusters. â¡ï¸ The launch of Minipack3N, a 51.2 Tbps switch based on NVIDIA Spectrum-4, and new optics for 400G/800G interconnects. â¡ï¸ Metaâ€™s role as a founding participant in the Ethernet for Scale-Up Networking (ESUN) initiative, working with industry leaders to advance open standards for AI networking. For those at the show, we even gave a sneak peek of our next-generation, liquid-cooled rack full of network switches, aligned to the power density curve of future accelerators - more on that comingâ€¦ These advances are the result of deep cross-team collaboration and a shared commitment to open, scalable, and efficient infrastructure. Iâ€™m grateful to work alongside so many talented engineers and partners â€“ both at Meta, and across the OCP community. ğŸ‘‰ Read the full blog post: https://lnkd.in/g-33_3CZ If youâ€™re passionate about open hardware, AI, and the future of networking, I invite you to join the conversation and help shape what comes next. #OCP2025 #OpenCompute #AIInfrastructure #OpenHardware #Meta
